DOCNAME: CASE OF AKIN ŞAHİN v. TURKEY
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , a former lieutenant , was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . After being expelled from the armed forces for disciplinary and ethical reasons , mainly on account of his excessive indebtedness and his failure to discharge his debts , the applicant brought an action before ORG against ORG for the annulment of the expulsion order .
CARDINAL . An action for fraud was subsequently filed against the applicant before the criminal courts .

CARDINAL . ORG submitted certain documents and information to ORG regarding the applicant ’s expulsion , which were classified as “ secret documents ” under LAW no . DATE on ORG . These documents were not disclosed to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing , which the applicant attended , and on DATE it rejected the applicant ’s case . The court refused to hear the applicant ’s witnesses , holding that the witness statements would not make any difference to the applicant ’s position in the circumstances of the present case and that the examination could be sufficiently conducted on the basis of the documents in the case file .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s rectification request .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law can be found in the decision of GPE v. GPE ( ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE ) .
